segments.text: Why did he invite her here?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why does that bother you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's been in New York three and half years why all of a sudden-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, maybe he just wanted to see her again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you mean? He lived next door to the girl all his life, why wouldn't he want to see her again?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't look at me like that, he didn't tell me any more than he told you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He's not going to marry her.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know he's even thinking of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's got that all about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, so what?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What's going on here Joe?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All right. Now, listen kid-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: -She's not his girl Joe; she knows she's not.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can't read her mind.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Then why is she still single, I mean New York is full of men, why isn't she married? Probably a hundred people told her she's crazy but she's waited.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know why she has waited?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She knows what I know, that's why. She's faithful as a rock. In my worst moments I think of her waiting and I know again that I'm right.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look it's a nice day, what are we arguing for?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody in this house dares take her faith away Joe. Strangers might, but not his father, not his brother.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you want me to do about it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I want you to act like he's coming back, both of you. Don't you think I haven't noticed since he invited her, I won't stand for any nonsense
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: But Kate
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because if he's not coming back, I'll kill myself. And laugh -- laugh at me but
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: why did that happen the very night she came back she sleeps in his room and suddenly his memorial breaks to pieces, just look at it, look.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I need you to believe with me; I can't stand all alone.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Even last week there was a man who showed up in Detroit missing longer than Larry, you read it yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All right. All right. Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just you above all need to believe.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Wait, why my above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't stop believing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What does that mean, me above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Look at you -- look at you shaking.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't help it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What have I got to hide? What the hell is the matter with you, Kate?
segments.speaker: M
